statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Michigan 66, Penn State 62
article.story: STATE COLLEGE, Pa. (AP) -- Ron Coleman scored 12 points, all on four second-half 3-pointers, as Michigan defeated Penn State 66-62 Saturday. The Wolverines (12-5, 3-0 Big Ten) remained undefeated in conference play, winning their sixth straight game this season and their seventh straight over the Nittany Lions (6-11, 0-4). The Lions pulled to within 59-57 with less than two minutes remaining, but Coleman hit his fourth 3-pointer of the half to put Michigan up by five, ending any suspense. Penn State had captured a brief 37-35 lead early in the second half and kept things close until Coleman got hot, hitting two 3-pointers in a span of a minute to turn a 1-point Michigan lead into a 50-43 advantage. Coleman was held scoreless in the first half on just 0-of-2 shooting, but finished 4-of-9 from the floor and 4-of-8 from behind the arc. While Coleman was cold in the first half, Dion Harris hit three 3-pointers in four minutes and had all 14 of his points by halftime. The Lions were led by Travis Parker, who had 19 points on 7-of-13 shooting, including 3-of-6 on 3-pointers. Penn State also got 13 points from Geary Claxton and Ben Luber, plus 11 from Aaron Johnson. Graham Brown scored 13 points off the bench for the Wolverines.
